trial_identification.studytitle: An open label phase 2 study of doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide followed by paclitaxel (AC-T) delivered every 14 days with pegfilgrastim and darbepoetin alfa support for the adjuvant treatment of women with breast cancer
trial_identification.scientifictitle: An open label phase 2 study of doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide followed by paclitaxel (AC-T) delivered every 14 days with pegfilgrastim and darbepoetin alfa support for the adjuvant treatment of women with breast cancer

interventions.interventions: Dose dense doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide followed by paclitaxel will be given to patients every 14 days for a total of 8 cycles. Each cycle will be suported with pegfilgrastim and for patients who have HB <110 g/ml, darbepotin alfa will be administered.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of subjects experiencing a delay in any cycle of chemotherapy at any time over the course of the study.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of chemotherapy cycles dose delayed at any time over the course of study.
Proportion of subjects experencing any dose reduction at any time over the course of the study.
Proportion of chemotherapy cycles dose reduced at any time over the course of study.
Proportion of chemotherapy cycles dose delayed due to haematological toxicity at any time over the course of study.
Incidence of febrile neutropenia at any time during the study.
Incidence, units and reasons for RBC transfusion at any time during the study.
Incidence of adverse events at any time over the course of the study.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1) Lymph node positive (AJCC stage IIA, IIB or IIIA (T0-3, N1-2, M0) OR 2) High risk lymph node negative, defined as any/all of the following: Hormone receptor negative, <35 years old, T2-3, Histological grade III-Primary surgery consisting of removal of the entire cancer-ECOG 0, 1 or 2-Normal marrow and organ function.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Stage IIIB, IIIC or IV breast cancer- Documented HER2 neu postive disease- Prior malignancy within 5 years except curatively treated basal cell carcinoma, in-situ cervical catrcinoma or a surgically cured malignancy- Previous cytotoxic chemotherapy or therapeutic radiation.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is a dose dense breast cancer study in teh adjuvant setting using growth factor support
